symptom_description: Chills refer to the feeling of coldness or shivering, often accompanied by a sensation of cold and sometimes fever. They can be caused by various infections, illnesses, or exposure to cold temperatures.

doctor_conversations.prompt: How long have you been experiencing chills?
patient_responses: I've been having chills for the past 24 hours.
It's been going on for several days now.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Have you taken any over-the-counter medication to alleviate the chills?
patient_responses: Yes, I took some over-the-counter fever-reducing medication.
No, I haven't taken any medication for it yet.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Make sure to keep warm, rest, and consider seeing a healthcare professional if your chills persist or worsen.
patient_responses: I'll bundle up and rest in bed.
I'll monitor my condition and seek medical advice if needed.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Are you experiencing any other symptoms, such as fever, cough, or body aches?
patient_responses: I have a fever and a persistent cough in addition to chills.
No, I don't have any other symptoms.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Have you been in close contact with someone who has had similar symptoms recently?
patient_responses: Yes, my coworker had chills and fever last week.
No, I haven't been in close contact with anyone with similar symptoms.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Do you have any underlying health conditions or chronic illnesses?
patient_responses: I have a history of respiratory issues.
I don't have any known underlying health conditions.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Have you traveled to areas with extreme cold temperatures recently?
patient_responses: I went on a ski trip to a very cold region last week.
No, I haven't been to such areas recently.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Is your skin visibly cold to the touch, or do you experience any trembling or shivering?
patient_responses: Yes, my skin is cold, and I'm shivering.
No, my skin feels normal, and I'm not shivering.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Have you recently engaged in activities that may have exposed you to cold or wet conditions?
patient_responses: I was caught in heavy rain last night.
I haven't been exposed to cold or wet conditions recently.

doctor_conversations.prompt: Is there a specific time of day or night when the chills worsen?
patient_responses: They seem to get worse in the evening and at night.
My chills are consistent throughout the day.
